# ipify

> ipify is a simple, open-source public IP address API that returns the caller's public IP (IPv4/IPv6). It provides plain text, JSON, and JSONP formats and is widely used for lightweight network checks.

## Overview
- Simple "what is my IP" API.
- Open source and production-grade; quick, low-latency responses.
- Supports plain text, JSON, and JSONP response formats.

## API Endpoints
- `https://api.ipify.org` — plain text (default)
- `https://api6.ipify.org` — IPv6-first endpoint (returns IPv6 if available)
- `https://api64.ipify.org` — universal endpoint (IPv4 or IPv6)
- Query parameters:
  - `?format=json` → JSON: {"ip":"1.2.3.4"}
  - `?callback=yourFunctionName` → JSONP: yourFunctionName({...})

## Quick usage examples

# Plain text (curl)
curl https://api.ipify.org

# JSON (curl)
curl 'https://api.ipify.org?format=json'

# JSONP (curl, browser)
curl 'https://api.ipify.org?format=json&callback=mycb'

# Node.js / fetch
node -e "fetch('https://api.ipify.org?format=json').then(r=>r.json()).then(d=>console.log(d.ip)).catch(e=>console.error(e));"

## Response formats
- text/plain (default, raw IP)
- application/json (?format=json, response: {"ip":"..."})
- application/javascript (?callback=yourFunc, JSONP callback)

## Service policies & guarantees
- "No visitor information is ever logged." — ipify.org (verify current policy before production use)
- Open source and community maintained — see GitHub
- High availability; lightweight, low-latency responses

## Fallbacks, caching & client guidance
- Use `https://api64.ipify.org` as a universal fallback
- Cache IP locally for a few minutes to reduce requests
- Backoff on HTTP 429 responses; retry with exponential backoff
- Use JSONP if calling from a browser and CORS blocks direct JSON

## Libraries & integrations
- Go client: https://github.com/rdegges/go-ipify
- npm: ipify (sindresorhus) and ipify-cli

## Maintenance metadata & contact
- Last updated: 2025-10-06
- Review cadence: quarterly
- Contribute / issues: 
  - https://github.com/rdegges/ipify
  - https://github.com/sindresorhus/ipify
- Robots & sitemap: Place this file at site root as `/llms.txt`. Agents should follow robots.txt and sitemap.xml rules.
